# Academic History
- **University of Waterloo** - Doctor of Philosophy in Statistics (2018 - 2022) <small class='fw-light d-block my-2'>I completed my PhD under the joint supervision of Drs Michael Wallace and Grace Yi. My thesis research revolved around measurement error, causal inference, and the interface of those subjects. (Thesis: [Generalizations to Corrections of Measurement Error Effects for Dynamic Treatment Regimes
](https://uwspace.uwaterloo.ca/handle/10012/18581){target="_blank"}.)</small>
- **University of Waterloo** - Masters of Mathematics in Statistics (2017 - 2018) <small class='fw-light d-block my-2'>I completed my Masters degree, under the supervision of Michael Wallace, in statistics. My Masters work was titled ‘Measurement error and personalized medicine: error-prone tailoring covariates in dynamic treatment regimes.’</small>
- **Queen's University** - Bachelor of Commerce (2013 - 2017) <small class='fw-light d-block my-2'>I did (three years) of my undergraduate at Queen’s University, Kingston, where I studied Finance and Mathematics. My first year was at the University of Waterloo/Wilfrid Laurier University, in the BMath/BBA Double Degree Program.</small>
